page.title: 14THE VILLAGE POSTWOMAN
page.content: Being a village postwoman I don't get the variety of jobs that my contempories in the big offices do.My job is just on the delivery side.I start at 6.30am when the mail arrives at the Post Office, brought by the postman in a van, as he goes through to West Meon.I sort the letters into order then deliver them and any parcels around the village.Delivering in the village is easy as it is fairly flat.Delivering to the outlying houses however is a different matter as the ground is rough, hilly and very treacherous in the winter.I finish at approx: 10.15am then it is back home for a welcome cuppa.
